title: Walmart's AI app factory: Walmart Element explained | Nikhilesh Tayal posted on the topic | LinkedIn
snippet: With the new Qualified Invoice System (Oct 2023) and JP PINT e-invoicing standard, companies are literally being pushed from paper to digital.
extractedText: Nikhilesh Tayal 5mo Report this post Walmart’s AI app factory: A masterclass in Enterprise-Scale AI deployment Yes, Walmart is quietly building one of the most sophisticated internal AI platforms in retail: Walmart Element. What is it? Element is Walmart’s cloud-agnostic, model-agnostic AI development platform, powering dozens of smart apps used by store personnel daily. Think of it as an assembly line for AI apps, streamlined, scalable, and built entirely in-house. What it does: - Combines data from 240M+ customers & 2M+ employees - Automatically selects optimal open-source models based on performance & cost - Deploys across Google Cloud, Azure, and Walmart’s own infrastructure - Ensures governance, cost control, and explainability from the ground up Examples in action: - Shift planning: Predicts staffing needs, manages clock-ins, and schedules - VizPick: to find high-demand inventory in the backroom - Real-time translation: Supports 44 languages, customised for Walmart lingo Operating across 19 countries and 10,000+ stores, Element is not just a tech experiment, it’s a business transformation engine. The takeaway? Don’t just adopt AI. Assemble your own AI factory. 21 8 Comments Like Comment Share Copy LinkedIn Facebook X Anant Shukla 5mo Report this comment Walmart turning AI into an assembly line is such a smart move. It’s like rethinking the process itself, not just the tools...makes me wonder how many industries could benefit from this kind of approach.
